summary: The NFIP Extension Act, introduced in the Senate, aims to reauthorize the National Flood Insurance Program (NFIP). The bill amends the National Flood Insurance Act of 1968, extending the program's financing and expiration dates from September 30, 2023, to September 30, 2026. A retroactive effective date is included to ensure the amendments take effect as of September 30, 2025, if the bill is enacted after that date.
